actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow a limited exclusion in the case of income received by an individual from hobbies and other activities not engaged in for profit.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an individual whose amounts derived from activities not engaged in for profit exceeds the deductions attributable to such activities, and the amount of such excess is $500 or less, to elect to exclude such amounts from gross income. Prohibits such election if for two or more of the taxable years in the period of five consecutive years preceding the election year the amounts derived from activities not engaged in for profit exceeds the deductions allowable for such activities by more than $1,000.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow a limited exclusion in the case of income received by an individual from hobbies and other activities not engaged in for profit.
